thread.title: More than 11,000 new North East companies launched last year, showing region is open for business

author: Coreena Ford
title: More than 11,000 new North East companies launched last year, showing region is open for business

organizations.name: inform direct review of uk company formations

text:
Business More than 11,000 new North East companies launched last year, showing region is open for business Fresh data from the Inform Direct Review of UK Company Formations shows how many businesses were formed - and dissolved - last year Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get business updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
More than 11,000 new companies were formed in the North East last year, demonstrating that the region provides a strong environment for new business ventures. 
Statistics have been compiled for the Inform Direct Review of UK Company Formations, using data from Companies House and the Office for National Statistics. 
The figures show that 6,166 new companies were formed in the Tyneside and Wearside areas, while 4,797 were dissolved. 
This brings the total number of registered companies in Tyne and Wear to 40,273, up from 38,544 at the end of 2016. 
Newcastle formed the most new businesses, with 1,917, followed by Gateshead with 1,189 and Sunderland with 1,176. 
A total of 1,360 firms were formed in Northumberland, which now has 10,100 companies, while 4,077 were launched in County Durham, where 26,562 firms are now trading. 
The region came 26th in a league table comparing areas for company formations, with London expectedly topping the list with 205,527. 
Inform Direct bosses said the North East figures show entrepreneurs are keen to kickstart their operations in the region – but growth has slowed over the last three years. 
The number of businesses in operation in the region in 2015 compared to 2014, grew by 6.5%, but this has slowly dipped over time, to 5.2% in 2016 and 4.5% last year. Read More Sir John Hall tells Theresa May to show more leadership over Brexit talks 
John Korchak, director of operations at Inform Direct said political uncertainty and the potential impact of Brexit may be a factor. 
He said: “These figures for new company formations during 2017 show that Tyne and Wear continues to be a fertile ground for entrepreneurs and new business ventures. 
“Although a successful year, there was a fall in the number of new businesses established in 2017, compared to the previous year – 6,166 versus 6,380 in 2016 – which mirrors the national trend. 
“This slowdown could be attributed, at least in part, to ongoing political uncertainty and concern in the business community over the impact of Brexit.” Read More Brexit: If there was another referendum how would you vote? Geordies have their say 
Across the UK as a whole, there was a reduction in the number of new company formations – 634,116 compared with 664,720 at the end of 2016. 
However the number of registered companies in the UK as a whole continued to grow, passing the 4,000,000 milestone during 2017 and finishing the year with a total of 4,120,349. Like us on Facebook
